definition[0]: an occasion when people stop working or leave a meeting as a protest
example[0]: Members of the Irish delegation staged a walk-out.
definition[1]: an occasion when workers stop working and leave their office or factory as a protest
example[1]: The talks broke off on Tuesday, prompting anationwide walkout of about 200,000 rail workers.
example[2]: Workersstaged a walkout at the companyâ€™s engine factory as the union continued its strike action.
